column1: The limits to legal absurdity stretched another notch this week when the Supreme Court refused to hear an appeal from a case that says corporate defendants must pay damages even after proving that they could not possibly have caused the harm .

column2: technology and innovation .

column2: a single court decision becomes the precedent for other
column3: less compelling cases .

column1: From the 1940s until 1971
